channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Mahmoud Khalil Returns to New York After Months in Detention
item.description: The Trump administration remains committed to deporting Mr. Khalil, a Columbia graduate and leading figure in the pro-Palestinian protest movement.

item.title: Far-Right Party Tries to Expand Its Appeal in Germany’s West
item.description: To reach voters outside its Eastern heartlands, the AfD is putting a new gloss on its anti-immigrant message — while sticking with its agenda.

item.title: Midwest Cities Bake as Heat Wave Blankets the Central U.S.
item.description: St. Louis, Chicago and Des Moines were among the cities that saw heat indexes hit triple digits on Saturday, with the East Coast bracing for similar c...

item.title: With Military Strike His Predecessors Avoided, Trump Takes a Huge Gamble
item.description: President Trump is betting the United States can repel whatever retaliation Iran orders, and that it has destroyed the regime’s chances of reconstitut...

item.title: Trump says U.S. 'completely and totally obliterated' nuclear facilities in Iran
item.description: The attack marks a major escalation in the burgeoning war between Iran and Israel and came despite years of promises by President Trump to keep the U....

item.title: Covering the military parade and a No Kings rally on the same day
item.description: Frank Langfitt has covered the world. Now he reports for NPR as a roving correspondent, focusing on stories that help us understand a changing America...

item.title: Europe Is Finally Ready to Spend More on Defense. The Hard Part Is How.
item.description: After a yearslong debate over NATO spending, European nations are poised to commit more funds to deter Russia. Now the region must decide how to unify...

item.title: Iran Had Vowed to Retaliate. Now, It Faces Grim Choices.
item.description: Iran’s foreign minister warned that the U.S. decision to join Israel’s war against Iran would have “everlasting consequences.”

item.title: Israel-Iran Conflict: Live Updates: Trump Claims Success After Bombing Key Iran Nuclear Sites
item.description: After hitting Iran’s most heavily fortified nuclear installation, President Trump warned of more strikes “if peace does not come quickly.” Israel’s pr...

item.title: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, Planning for His Possible Assassination, Picks Successors
item.description: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has picked replacements in case military commanders die in Israeli strikes. He has also named possible replacements for himself...

item.title: U.S. strikes key nuclear sites in Iran.
At least three people dead from a tornado in North Dakota
item.description: At least three residents were killed in the Enderlin area by a tornado on Friday night after storms hit North Dakota and Minnesota.

item.title: Pilot who died in N.C. plane crash tried to avoid a turtle on airport runway
item.description: The pilot of a small plane that crashed near an airport tried to avoid hitting a turtle on the runway, according to a National Transportation Safety B...

item.title: One daughter's search for a father detained by ICE
item.description: Francisco Urizar, 64, was detained by ICE while on his work route delivering tortillas. His daughter Nancy is trying to find out what happened to him.
